tournament.name: Friday 2nd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and utilizing Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. It utilizes cards like Legion Warboss and Charming Prince to create tokens, while also including versatile spells like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant for removal and disruption. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and capitalize on Winota's ability to put multiple threats into play at once. The inclusion of Haktos the Unscarred and Kenrith, the Returned King provides additional power and versatility to push for a fast victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful control spells like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion while utilizing Fires of Invention to play high-cost spells for free. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently removing threats and gradually gaining advantage until you can close out the game with powerful finishers like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion ensures a consistent stream of cards to maintain control over the board.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to stall the opponent's threats with cards like Shatter the Sky and Teferi, Time Raveler, while generating value through cards like Agent of Treachery and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value by flickering permanents. By consistently answering threats and generating card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in the late game.

The deck focuses on aggressively cycling cards to build up a board presence and deal damage quickly. Cards like Improbable Alliance, Startling Development, and Zenith Flare are used to cycle cards efficiently while also dealing damage. Drannith Stinger and Drannith Healer provide additional support and synergy with cycling cards. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of creatures and burn spells, while also gaining advantage through card draw. The mana base is designed to support quick cycling and efficient spell casting.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, card advantage engines, and powerful planeswalkers. With a mix of disruptive and proactive elements, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the board until victory can be achieved. The deck utilizes a variety of powerful cards that provide multiple forms of interaction and flexibility, enabling the player to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver their opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful spells and cards that allow the player to manipulate the board state and out-value their opponent. It utilizes a combination of card draw, counterspells, removal, and powerful threats like Agent of Treachery and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to maintain control of the game. The companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for added value. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage and strategic play.

The deck focuses on cycling cards efficiently to build a board presence and get value out of cycling triggers. By constantly cycling through the deck, players can generate a large amount of tokens with Valiant Rescuer and Flourishing Fox to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Zenith Flare serves as a finisher by dealing damage based on the number of cards cycled, while also gaining life to prolong the game. The synergy between cycling cards and cheap creatures allows for a fast-paced aggressive strategy that can catch opponents off guard.

This deck focuses on quickly playing creatures to trigger Winota's ability, allowing you to put powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery onto the battlefield for free. It also includes disruption cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Charming Prince to control the game and protect your board. With a mix of creatures with different casting costs and abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and powerful ETB effects to secure victory in the early game.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing a variety of planeswalkers and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategies and card advantage. It focuses on board wipes and card draw to maintain control of the battlefield and outvalue the opponent over time. With Yorion as a companion, the deck can generate even more value by blinking permanents for additional triggers and ETB effects. The mana base is designed to support a variety of color requirements for the spells in the deck, ensuring consistency in casting the powerful control cards.

The deck focuses on aggressively cycling through cards to build up a strong board presence and deal damage quickly. The key strategy involves using cycling cards like Boon of the Wish-Giver and Startling Development to trigger abilities from cards like Valiant Rescuer and Drannith Stinger. Zenith Flare serves as a powerful finisher by dealing damage based on the number of cards cycled. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing players to recast cycling creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of cycling triggers and efficient creature plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Shark Typhoon and Shatter the Sky. The deck also takes advantage of Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast's ability to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, while using cards like Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with threats. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for extra triggers.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures that can generate value through cycling cards. By cycling through the deck quickly, it aims to accumulate cards in the graveyard to fuel powerful spells like Zenith Flare and Improbable Alliance. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recurring key creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Drannith Stinger and Drannith Healer for additional synergy with cycling cards. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays using creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Rotting Regisaur, and Hunted Nightmare along with supporting cards like Shadowspear, Heraldic Banner, and Drill Bit. The presence of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the damage output of odd-costed cards in the deck. The mono Black color scheme ensures consistency in casting spells and abilities while utilizing cards like Serrated Scorpion and Gutterbones for extra value. Castle Locthwain provides card draw and Mobilized District offers a versatile threat.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought Erasure, Duress, and Mystical Dispute. It also includes removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Tyrant's Scorn to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to generate card advantage and ramp into powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis, Uro, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. By utilizing a mix of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately take control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing counterspells and disruptive spells to control the game while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. It aims to play a long game, generating value with cards like Uro and Shark Typhoon, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion. The deck also includes synergies with lands and card draw, allowing for consistency and flexibility in adapting to different situations. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and secure a victory through strategic decision-making and resource management.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana and Shark Typhoon to create threats. The deck aims to stabilize the board and outvalue the opponent with powerful spells like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Expansion / Explosion. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to establish control of the game and win through incremental advantage and powerful finishers.
